title: Random high ping during games
body:
Hi, 

Its got to that point now that I am unable to play ranked anymore as at random times during the game I can get ping spikes around 300-400 ping.
The worst has been at least 2k ping, its starting to get a bit ridiculous. And from what I remember I think this started happening since patch 5.7.
My friend who is also in the same city as I am also gets these random ping spikes also and we are with different ISPs.
We live in New Zealand.

Its not a constant high ping, but annoying during lane phase and team fights when it occurs.
If anyone else in New Zealand or on this server in general is getting the same kind of issues then please sound off. I don't believe this has to do with my set up if I know other people who are getting this also.

Any help will be appreciated

replies.body:
Nope Slingshot, BUT my friend is with Spark.

not sure if Slingshot/Spark go with the same exchanges etc. But maybe!

It's a possibility. I've just heard absolute nightmares from Spark users and League, which pretty much match up to what you described.

If possible, try using another internet source such as tethering your phone's data (League game usually takes 15MB) or going to a public Wifi hotspot, in addition to switching out wireless for wired in your own home.

Can you do a network diagnostics? Go to this site: http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/ and perform a test. You need Java enabled. Report here any findings that appear as red in your diagnosis; the rest is usually irrelevant. **Do not post the entire report in the post.**

I use Spark internet and it is absolutly terrible, ping spikes all the time, and crashes every other hour and makes you have to reset your client, its disgusting how they get away with providing this "service".
